long: Meaning: a "nonentity"; generally used as a negative particle.  Usage: else, except, fail, (father-) less, be gone, in(-curable), neither, never, no (where), none, nor, (any, thing), not, nothing, to nought, past, un(-searchable), well-nigh, without. Compare "H370".  Source: as if from a primitive root meaning to "be nothing" or "not exist";
